required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Korean Observational Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Anagliptin Switching From Other DPP4is in type2 DM
clinical_study.official_title: A Non-interventional, Single Group, Open-label, Multicenter Observational Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Anagliptin in Type 2 Diabetic Patients With Other DPP4is as Mono or Combination Therapy With Insufficient Glucose Control

brief_summary.textblock: This study was designed as a non-interventional, single-group, open-label, multicenter observational study for patients with type 2 diabetes in the real world clinical setting.

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects will visit the site on the 12th week (Visit 2) and 24th week (Visit 3) from the registration date (Visit 1) to confirm the efficacy and safety.
Primary endpoint
- HbA1c change after 24 weeks treatment
Secondary endpoint
- Average rate of change in HbA1c after baseline
- Ratio of subjects with HbA1c<7% after 24 weeks
- Ratio of subjects with HbA1c<6.5% after 24 weeks
- Subgroup analysis by gender, age, BMI, medical history, renal function, liver function, conventional DPP4 inhibitors therapy, concomitant Oral Antidiabetic Drug, duration of disease
Safety endpoint : Adverse Event

study_pop.textblock: Type 2 diabetic patients with other DPP4is as mono or combination therapy with insufficient glucose control

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 19 years of age at the time of consenting
- Understands and is willing to sign an informed consent form (ICF)
- HbA1câ‰¥7.0%
- within 7days before registration, continuing other DPP4is alone or combined therapy for than 8 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior exposure to Anagliptin

facility.name: The Catholic University of Korea, Bucheon ST. Mary's hopsital
